article_node.title: India minister says country hopes to clinch US trade deal by November
article_node.summary: India aims to finalize a bilateral trade agreement with the United States by November, according to Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal. Negotiations with the EU are progressing and ties with China are normalizing. India has already secured trade deals with Mauritius, Australia, EFTA, the UK, and the UAE. The US has imposed a 50% tariff on key Indian exports since August 27, reflecting strained relations over tariffs and Indian purchases of Russian oil.
